abstracts.cdata!:
The Additional Financing for the Second
            Pakistan Poverty Alleviation Fund Project (PPAF-II) to
            support Participatory Development through Social
            Mobilization will help finance relief activities, and the
            costs associated with the rehabilitation, reconstruction,
            and new construction of village-level infrastructure,
            including community buildings, link roads, water and
            sanitation, and housing. This will be achieved with the full
            participation of communities who will be mobilized into
            community organizations by Partner Organization's (POs)
            of the PPAF. Funds from this additional financing will be
            used to carry out all originally planned development
            activities that were specifically earmarked for the
            twenty-five of the recipient's poorest districts. No
            community organizations or members will be dropped due to
            this amendment, but instead additional geographical areas
            and rural communities in the Sindh coastal areas will be
            added as project beneficiaries. By adding 'grant'
            type activities and additional geographical areas to this
            additional financing, it is expected that funds will be able
            to be utilized before the closing date of June 30, 2010 - in
            addition to achieving all the original and new outcomes. The
            project's components, activities and scope are to be
            modified by: (i) including the financing of
            'grants' for Small-Scale Community Infrastructure
            Development Projects (SSIPs) and Social Sector Development
            Projects (SSDPs), which are current components and
            activities of PPAF-II; and (ii) expanding the scope of the
            project to include an additional four districts in the Sindh
            coastal areas.
